isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - INSTALL - CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 9200i/9400i/9900i DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES after DECEMBER 2001

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 9200 i/9400 i/9900 i DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES after DECEMBER 2001

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 108 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i day cab models without Detroit Diesel engines after December 2001 contains one air spring (bag) (Item 5), two shock absorbers (Items 6 and 7), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 8). The air suspension system components are not interchangeable with different cab models.

The following components - air line (to air spring) (Item 14), hex nipple fitting (Item 12) and elbow fittings (Items 13 and 26), air spring (bag) (Item 5), height control valve (Item 8), shock absorbers (Items 6 and 7) and lateral control rod (Item 4) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 8), air spring (bag) (Item 5) and shock absorbers (Items 6 and 7) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para:
Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and air line fitting connections. Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for (Figure 108) for proper tightening of all fasteners and air line fitting connections.

svcsubproc.title: Install Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 8, Figure 108) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 109 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Inspect height control valve (Item 5) to insure drive bearing notch (Item 10) is located on "SUPS" port side of valve. If not, loosen pan head bearing screw (Item 11), but not remove, and pull height control valve arm (Item 7) loose from drive bearing (Item 12). Rotate drive bearing until drive bearing notch is in correct position, then secure height control valve lever by tightening pan head bearing screw. Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-in (4.5 to 5.6 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 108 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position height control valve (Item 8) on mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1).

Install two hex head bolts (Item 15) thru height control valve and mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1) and install hex lock nuts (Item 16). Tighten hex head bolts and hex lock nuts to 8 to 10 Lbf-ft (11 to 14 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 109 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para:
Push air line (supply) (Item 2) into compression nut (Item 1) of elbow fitting (Item 13) in "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 5). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of compression nut.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 4) into compression nut (Item 3) of elbow fitting (Item 14) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 5). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of compression nut.

Install height control valve linkage (Item 6) onto threaded ball pivot of height control valve arm (Item 7) by positioning the height control valve linkage socket over threaded ball pivot and pushing linkage socket onto threaded ball pivot until it snaps in place, latch the linkage clip.
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

Check cab ride height between bottom of lateral control arm and top of air suspension lower mounting plate of cab air suspension system (Figure 170) . Cab air suspension ride height is 2 inches (50.8 mm). If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 9200 i /9400 i /9900 i DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES AFTER DECEMBER 2001
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 108 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Position top of shock absorber (Item 6) in place in shock mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Install hex head bolt (Item 18) from inboard side and install hex lock nut (Item 20). Tighten hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 18 and 20) to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).
Position bottom of shock absorber (Item 6) in place in shock mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 3).
Install hex head bolt (Item 18) from inboard side and install hex lock nut (Item 20). Tighten hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 18 and 20) to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).
Position top of shock absorber (Item 7) in place in shock mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Install hex head bolt (Item 18) from inboard side and install hex lock nut (Item 20). Tighten hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 18 and 20) to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).
Position bottom of shock absorber (Item 7) in place in shock mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 3).
Install hex head bolt (Item 18) from inboard side and install hex lock nut (Item 20). Tighten hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 18 and 20) to 40 to 50 Lbf-ft (54 to 68 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Ride Air Spring (Bag)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 108 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position air spring (bag) (Item 5) in place between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 3).
Install socket countersunk flat head screw (Item 22) thru crossmember mounting plate (Item 3) into bottom of air spring (bag). Tighten to 2 to 4 Lbf-ft (3 to 5 N•m).
Install hex head bolt (Item 21) with lock washer (Item 23) thru cab mounting plate (Item 1) into top of air spring (bag) (item 5). Tighten to 2 to 4 Lbf-ft (3 to 5 N•m).

Install hex nipple fitting (Item 12) into top of air spring (bag) (Item 5) and tighten. Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Install elbow fitting (Item 13) onto hex nipple fitting (Item 12) of air spring (bag) (Item 5) and tighten. Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 14) into compression nut of elbow fitting (Item 13) at top of air spring (bag) (Item 5). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of compression nut.
Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.

Check cab ride height between bottom of lateral control arm and top of air suspension lower mounting plate of cab air suspension system (Figure 170) . Cab air suspension ride height is 2 inches (50.8 mm). If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR RIDE SYSTEM FOR 9200 i /9400 i /9900 i DAY CAB MODELS WITHOUT DETROIT DIESEL ENGINES AFTER DECEMBER 2001
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 108 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install lateral control rod (Item 4) as follows.

step2.para: Position lateral control rod (Item 4) in mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 3) and install hex head bolt (Item 24) from the rear thru mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate and lateral control rod and install hex lock nut (Item 25). Tighten to 40 to 45 Lbf-ft (54 to 61 N•m).

Position lateral control rod (Item 4) in mounting bracket of cab mounting plate (Item 1) and install hex head bolt (Item 24) thru cab mounting plate and lateral control rod and install hex lock nut (Item 25). Tighten to 40 to 45 Lbf-ft (54 to 61 N•m).
